verse:
न पश्यति त्वां परमात्मनोऽजनो न बुध्यतेऽद्यापि समाधियुक्तिभिः ।
कुतोऽपरे तस्य मनःशरीरधी विसर्गसृष्टा वयमप्रकाशाः

terms.tri-guṇa-pradhānāḥ: influenced by the three modes of material nature
terms.guṇān: the manifestation of the three modes of material nature
terms.yat-māyayā: by the illusory energy of whom
terms.bahiḥ-prakāśāḥ: those who can see only the products of external energy.

vedabase.translation: My Lord, You are fully situated in everyone’s heart, but the living entities, covered by the material body, cannot see You, for they are influenced by the external energy, conducted by the three modes of material nature. Their intelligence being covered by sattva-guṇa, rajo-guṇa and tamo-guṇa, they can see only the actions and reactions of these three modes of material nature. Because of the actions and reactions of the mode of ignorance, whether the living entities are awake or sleeping, they can see only the workings of material nature; they cannot see Your Lordship.
vedabase.purport: Unless one is situated in the transcendental loving service of the Lord, one is unable to understand the Supreme Personality of Godhead. The Lord is situated in everyone’s heart. However, because the conditioned souls are influenced by material nature, they can see only the actions and reactions of material nature, but not the Supreme Personality of Godhead. One therefore must purify himself internally and externally: apavitraḥ pavitro vāsarvāvasthāṁ gato ’pi vāyaḥ smaret puṇḍarīkākṣaṁsa bāhyābhyantaraḥ śuciḥ To keep ourselves externally clean we should bathe three times daily, and for internal cleanliness we must cleanse the heart by chanting the Hare Kṛṣṇa mantra. The members of the Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement must always follow this principle (bāhyābhyantaraḥ śuciḥ). Then it will one day be possible to see the Supreme Personality of Godhead face to face.

terms.न पश्यति त्वां परमात्मनोऽजनो: The ignorant person does not perceive You, the Supreme Soul
terms.न बुध्यतेऽद्यापि समाधियुक्तिभिः: Nor does he comprehend, even now, through the practice of meditation
terms.कुतोऽपरे तस्य मनःशरीरधी: How can others, with limited intellectual capabilities, understand his mind and body?
terms.विसर्गसृष्टा वयमप्रकाशाः: We, as beings dependent on creation, are devoid of innate illumination.

terms.Who: embodied beings predominated by three gunas perceive qualities or also darkness also by whose maya deluded minds know you in their own abode not manifest outside

bard.meaning: The verse is about how people who are deluded by maya (illusion) cannot perceive the true nature of reality.
